titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Papers on Yale Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 11:33

did.unittitle: Papers on Yale collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consists of essays, dissertations, and articles relating to Yale history.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 49 (YRG 49), Papers and projects on Yale.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The materials were the gift of various individuals and organizations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Written permission of the author is required for photocopying.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers on Yale Collection (RU 103). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consists of essays, dissertations, and articles relating to Yale history.

did.unittitle: Original collection of papers on Yale
Basagera, Susan, "Women and the Yale University School of Medicine: The first ten years,1916-1926." Includes bibliography.
Gile, Lawrence, "The Yale Peace Council and pacifism at Yale, 1936-1941." 25 p. Includes bibliography.
Kilpatrick, Donald, "The Emergence of organized athletics in nineteenth century American society: The Yale Experience." 1977. 47 p. Includes bibliography.
Mellen, Henry, "The British invasion of New Haven, 5 July 1779: A study of the heroic town-gown defense of the city." 77 p. Includes bibliography.
Kelly, Kevin J., "Yale men of the 'Rough Riders': Yale spirit in the 'Splendid Little War".' 22 p.
Riendeau, Bradford C.,"In respect to our Southern classmates." 18 p. map
Luneburg, Thomas R., "Yale and athletics in 1905-1906." 18 p. Includes bibliography.
Ortel, Erik,"The New Haven riots of 1919." 11 p. map. Includes bibliography.
Cromwell, Michael S., III, "The lessons of Dwight Hall." 24 p. Includes bibliography.
Kaufman, Robin, "The town-gown riot of 1854: A study of nativism and sectionalanimosities in Yale and New Haven." 35 p. Includes bibliography.
Heyison, Michael R., "The Conic Sections and Bread and Butter rebellions: Therise of student unity and activism at Yale College from 1825 to 1830." 30 p.
Smith, Mary Bruce, "Professor Benjamin Silliman: His religion and teaching." 13 p.
Mirchin, David I, "A composite biography of Yale-in-China bachelors, 1912-1917." 30 p.
Levine, Harold, "The Yale Daily-News. A study of extracurriculum at Yale." 17 p.
Green, Steve, "Yale secret societies of the nineteenth century." 15 p.
Mulrow, Bill, "DKE and the changing nature of Yale fraternities.''
Kohn, Roger S., "Elias Loomis (1811-1889). Pioneer American scientist." 52 p. Includes bibliography.
Spielman, Eli, "Payne Whitney gymnasium: The calm after the storm." 22 p.
Baskauskas, Michael, "The Payne Whitney gymnasium: Its development and use." 16 p.
Kilpatrick, Donald, "Yale's indoor playground. The Payne Whitney gymnasium." 18 p.
Sundel, Michael, "Yale and New Haven During the Great Depression." 82 p.
Schulman, Bruce J., "The Reorganization of the Institute of Human Relations at Yale, 1935-1938." 64 p.
Keehn, Sally, "Passed But Not Forgotten: The Story of the Whiffenpoof Song." 14 p.
Green, David, "An Architectural Overview of the Residential Colleges at Harvard and Yale." 176 p.

Straka, Kathy M. Umbricht, "The Linonian Society Library of Yale College, 1753-1853." 153 p. [Restricted: Permission to copy all or any part must come from author. Author retains all publication rights.]
Lyon, Richard Abod, "Beatrix Jones Farrand, landscape gardener."
Golden, Richard, 'The Radicalization of Yale College: 1755-1766.'' 96 p. Includes bibliography and bibliographical essay.
Lampert, David, "Suggestions For a Better Yale: A Compilation of Essays."
O'Connor, Br. Thomas Frederick, "The Yale University Library, 1865-1931." Columbia University Ph.D. Dissertation, 610 p.-- [all rights reserved]

Sheahan, Sr. Dorothy A., "The Social origins of American Nursing and ItsMovement into the University: A Microcosmic Approach." Ph.D. dissertation, New York University School of Education, Health, Nursing and Arts Professions. 617 p. [Restriction: No photocopying or quotation without permission of the author]
Condon, Patrick Edward, "Women' s Dormitory." 41 p.
Sabala, Mary, "A History of Alumni Hall." 27 p.
Nickerson, Richard, "From College to University: Yale's Bicentennial Buildings." 43 p.
Chren, Michael, "Bunshaft's Beinecke Library: The Failure of Modernist Aesthetic in Building and Drawing." 21 p.
Catlin, Daniel, Jr., "Liberal Education at Yale: The Yale College Course of Study 1945-1978." Princeton dissertation. 305 p.
Reifenstein, Edward C, "The Master Plans of Yale." 42 p.
Yulo, Christopher,"The Ritter family of stonecutters and their context in 19th century New Haven." 39 p.
Kent, Susan Rodgers, "Hillhouse Avenue: A Study of a Street and the Growth of an Aesthetic."
Greenberg, David, "Practical Politics in Academia: The Conflicts of the Yale Political Union, 1934-1988." 43 p.
Schlanger, Margo, "A Lively Lot of Women, Who Intend to Make Themselves of Use in This World: The Mothers' Club of Lowell House, 1900-1920." 373 p.
Snoke, Albert, "The Yale University School of Nursing, 1956-1967." [RESTRICTED]
Transcript of oral history interview with Paul Burnham concerning the use of Educational Testing Service tests at Yale
Weinberg, Jeremy, "Long Live the King's Yale. How Kingman Brewster's university survived and thrived in the 1960s."
Johnson, William R, "Letter concerning the history of Furioso ."
Umberger, Willis H, "Lyme and the Yale tradition"(Essay used as basis of presentation to the Class of 1929 luncheon)
Bockelman, Charles K, "Seven Provosts, 1968-1987"
Somerville, Peter. "Sex Drugs, and Rachmaninoff: Music at Yale in the Late 1960s," 2001.
Kilpatrick, Daniel "The Yale Student Body and Admissions Criteria During the 20th Century".
Tercentennial Essays
Gottshall, Mary S., "Yale's Role in the War: Preserving the Liberal Arts Education."
Leineweber, Thomas M., "The Voice of Branzeville An Examination of the Role of the Black Press of Chicago's South Side in the 1030's and 1940s."
Ahlbrandt, Julia, "The Pope, Martin Luther, and the Vietnam War: How Kingman Brewster and William Sloane Coffin United Yale Against All Odds."
Mazza, Peter, "Diplomas, Bibles, and Guns The Stories of Four Yale Men in the Civil War."
Daly, Radley H, "The Secretaries of Yale."
Horn, Michael Brian, "They Would Not Be Denied: The Yale Unit's Piloting Role in U.S. Military Aviation."
Lecture on the evolution of the American Studies major at Yale
Lecture on the evolution of the American Studies major at Yale
Smith, Suzanne, "History of Yale: 1960-1972"
Smith, Suzanne, "History of Yale: 1960-1972"
Senior essay for the history major, "Entering the Old Boys' Club: The Women of the Yale College Class of 1973 and Factors Affecting Their Entrance into the Professions"
Senior essay for the history major, "Entering the Old Boys' Club: The Women of the Yale College Class of 1973 and Factors Affecting Their Entrance into the Professions,"
"Seventy-five Years of Forestry Education: The Yale University School of Forestry & Environmental Studies, 1900-1975," by George Garrett
Garrett, George, "Seventy-five Years of Forestry Education: The Yale University School of Forestry & Environmental Studies, 1900-1975,"
Student papers
Furniss, Norman (YC 1945), "Undergraduate Life at Yale, 1820-1830"
Feinberg, Michael "Team Lux: 10 Years of Yale College Solar Racing - An Analysis"
Thomas Kaplan, "Yale Has Something to Sell" [computer file]

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Donor retains copyright. Requests to publish must be directed to donor until June 1, 2015, when all intellectual property rights are transferred to Yale.

did.unittitle: "The New Haven Free Public Library and the Yale University Press: The New and the Old Create a Perfect Contrast to the New Haven Green" by Michael Harten

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials are located in RU 554, Yale University Press Records, accession 2013-A-079, Evan's Wing files series.
